  500 00 $a The terminus ante quem derives from the buyer 's date in BL copy,  'in vigilia corporis christi anno mc. lxxximo ' (following the forthcoming Bodleian Library incunable catalogue; BMC interpreted the date as 20 May); GW postulates the terminus post quem

  500 00 $a In some copies, the date in the colophon is printed as  'lxxV decĭo nono ' (cf. BMC, GW), in others, correctly, as  'lxxV nono ' (cf. C 765, Pell and Oates)
  500 00 $a De conflictu vitiorum is apparently the work of Ambrosius Autpertus. The Speculum animae peccatricis, sometimes falsely attributed to Dionysius Carthusiensis, is now attributed either to Jacobus de Gruytrode (cf. Bloomfield) or to Jacobus de Clusa (cf. L. Meier, Die Werke des Erfurter Karthäusers Jakob von Jüterbog, Münster, 1955) (CIBN). Jacobus de Clusa also recorded as Jacobus de Jüterbog or de Paradiso (Verfasserlexikon 2, Bd 4 col.478ff)

  001 ia01333000
  008 801022s1472                        lat  
  100 10 $a Augustinus, Aurelius
  245 10 $a Soliloquia (Text beginning: Volventi mihi multa). Add: Speculum peccatoris
  260 00 $a [Augsburg $b Günther Zainer $c before 1473]
  300 00 $c f~~
  500 00 $a The edition includes both works, the Speculum peccatoris (Goff A1337) being found on [c]4-[c]8 (ff.24-28) of the BL copy IB.5541. IB.5541A is the same setting of the Speculum printed on a separate gathering (five leaves, [a]Ã with a leaf inserted after [a]3), presumably for separate issue. Often found with Goff A1089, A1225, E106, G221, H179, H192, I4 and P1001, in any combination. Some copies of the set (e.g. Windsor RL) have a separate small leaf with a collective title of the ten tracts (see BMC, reprint). The collection has H192 with rubricator 's date of  '72 ' in a private collection in USA (Roland Folter); previously dated before 5 June 1473 from the rubrication date ( '1473 vigil pentec ') of the Sammelband in Munich
  500 00 $a The two tracts are not in fact by Augustinus
  510 00 $a Goff A1333, A1337
  510 00 $a H 8589* (V, ff.83-105 & VI, ff.106-110)
  510 00 $a Pell Ms 6000 (5986)
